sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"升起，举起"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: lift, hoist, raise, elevate, heave, boost
means: lift ： 指用人力或机械力把某物升到较高的位置。
hoist ： 多指用绳索、滑轮等机械把重物升起。
raise ： 较正式用词，常可与lift换用，但强调把某物举起或抬起到应有的高度。常用比喻。
elevate ： 较正式用词，指位置、高度的升高，多作比喻用，指职位、品德等的提高。
heave ： 指需花大力气或借外力才能举起或抬起重物。
boost ： 原义指从后面或下面推起或提高，现常用于指提高价格、振作精神等抽象概念。

sentence.Network_en: Democracy might elevate the common man to a position of political superiority.
sentence.Network_cn: 民主也许能提升普通人的政治地位，让他们产生优越感。

sentence.Network_en: His energy and talent elevate him to godlike status.
sentence.Network_cn: 他因精力充沛、才华横溢而被尊为神人。

sentence.Network_en: He used a couple of bolsters to elevate his head.

list.abs: ...拿手的技能：的，睡觉（觉jiao主），幻想等等。, 不擅长的东西：体育，辣的食物，碳酸饮料（打嗝...），扫地，憋气，绘画以及分辨事物（电梯（elevator）和自动扶梯（escalator）的区别）, 生平：出生于，小学就读于，初中似乎就读于，后转至的高中并出演《》，之后考上大学？！.
英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... illegitimacy n 非法，不正当 elevator n 电梯，升降机 lever n 杠杆.
第五是抬高（Elevation），受了伤之后，下肢、上肢、膝关节要放在心脏以上的水平，这样可以减少肿胀的发生，促进静脉的回流。 …
托福词汇_百度文库 ... longitude 精度 elevation 海拔 altitude 高度.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin elevat- 'raised', from the verb elevare, from e- (variant of ex-) 'out, away' + levare 'lighten' (from levis 'light')

entry.def: When someone or something achieves a more important rank or status, you can say that they are elevated to it.

example.ex: He was elevated to the post of prime minister.

entry.def: If you elevate something to a higher status, you consider it to be better or more important than it really is.

example.ex: Don't elevate your superiors to superstar status.
example.tran: 别把你的上司捧得跟超级巨星似的。

entry.def: To elevate something means to increase it in amount or intensity.

example.ex: Emotional stress can elevate blood pressure.
example.tran: 情绪压力可能会导致血压升高。

example.ex: ...overweight individuals who have elevated cholesterol levels.
example.tran: 胆固醇水平升高的体重超标者

entry.def: If you elevate something, you raise it above a horizontal level.

example.ex: Jack elevated the gun at the sky.

means.word_mean: 1. give a promotion to or assign to a higher position;

sentences.sentence: "John was kicked upstairs when a replacement was hired"
"Women tend not to advance in the major law firms"
"I got promoted after many years of hard work"

means.word_mean: 2. raise from a lower to a higher position;

sentences.sentence: "The new law lifted many people from poverty"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 不相干的,离题的,与……不相干
stems_affixes.word_buile: ir不+relevant[adj.有关的,中肯的,相应的,实质性的]→adj.不相干的,离题的,与……不相干

stems_affixes.value_cn: 有关的,中肯的,相应的,实质性的
stems_affixes.word_buile: re再+lev举起,变轻+ant……的→再举起→有关的
elevate[v.举起,提拔,振奋,提升……的职位]+or器→n.电梯,升降机
lev举起,变轻+er表名词→举起[重东西]的东西
lever[n.杆,杠杆,手段,途径,工具]+age状态→n.杠杆作用
lev举起,变轻+ity表名词→n.轻率,轻浮
lev举起,变轻+y→提升[税]:to raise tax
al一再+lev举起,变轻+iate表动词→不断轻→减轻

stems_affixes.value_cn: 举起,提拔,振奋,提升……的职位
stems_affixes.word_buile: e出+lev举起,变轻+ate表动词→举出→升高
lev举起,变轻+it+ate表动词→使东西举起→升到空中
lev举起,变轻+y→提升[税]:to raise tax

Sentence.sentence: When we liberate the economic potential of women, we elevate the economic performance of communities, nations, and the world," she said.

means.word_mean: 鼓舞, 使更有修养;使情绪高昂；使精神振奋；使兴高采烈

sentences.en: The good news elevated everyone's spirits.
sentences.cn: 这个好消息鼓舞了每个人的情绪。

jushi.english: He used a couple of pillows to elevate his head.
Earth movements in the past elevated great areas of the seabed.
jushi.chinese: 过去地球的运动把大片的海床升高了。

jushi.english: His inspiring speech elevated the audience.
jushi.chinese: 他那鼓舞人心的话使听众为之振奋。
